net.xuset.objectIO.connections

Interface Hub<T extends Connection>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of Connection to store
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    InetHub<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConnectionHub, GroupClientHub, GroupNetServer, OfflineHub, TcpServer

    public interface Hub<T extends Connection>
    A container interface for Connection objects. Hub outlines simple operations that are performed on connections.

    It is worth noting that a connection does not have to be stored in a hub.

    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addConnection(T connection)
      Stores a connection.
      boolean broadcastMsg(MarkupMsg message)
      The supplied MarkupMsg is sent to all stored connections.

      Removes a previously stored connection.
      boolean sendMsg(MarkupMsg message, long connectionId)
      Finds a connection whose getId() equals the supplied argument connectionId, and then sends the message via the found connection.

    • Method Detail

      • getConnectionById

        T getConnectionById(long connectionId)
        Searches stored connections for an id matching the supplied argument id. The id of stored connections is determined by Connection.getId().

        It is good practice when adding connections to the hub to not add multiple connections with same id. This can cause unexpected results.

        Parameters:
        connectionId - the id of the connection to return
        Returns:
        returns a connection with an id equal to connectionId. If no connection is found, null is returned.

      • getConnectionByIndex

        T getConnectionByIndex(int index)
        Returns a stored connection. This can be used to traverse all the stored connections. Connections are not Guaranteed to be in specific order. If index is less than zero or greater than getConnectionCount() then a IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the element to return.
        Returns:
        the connection at the specified index
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of bounds

      • getConnectionCount

        int getConnectionCount()
        Returns the number of connections that are stored. This can be used along with getConnectionByIndex to access all the stored connections.
        Returns:
        the amount of connections stored.

      • addConnection

        boolean addConnection(T connection)
        Stores a connection. Once added, the connection can be retrieved using getConnectionById(long) and getConnectionByIndex(int)
        Parameters:
        connection - the connection to store
        Returns:
        true if the method was successful in adding the connection

      • removeConnection

        boolean removeConnection(T connection)
        Removes a previously stored connection.
        Parameters:
        connection - the connection to remove
        Returns:
        true if the connection was found and removed successfully

      • sendMsg

        boolean sendMsg(MarkupMsg message,
              long connectionId)
        Finds a connection whose getId() equals the supplied argument connectionId, and then sends the message via the found connection. Usually the message is sent by calling Connection.sendMsg(MarkupMsg) on the found connection.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to send
        connectionId - the id of the connection to use
        Returns:
        returns true if the message sent successfully or false if no connection was found or the sending the message failed

      • broadcastMsg

        boolean broadcastMsg(MarkupMsg message)
        The supplied MarkupMsg is sent to all stored connections. Usually this done by calling Connection.sendMsg(MarkupMsg) on each stored connection.
        Parameters:
        message - the message sent to all stored connections
        Returns:
        true if the broadcast was successful, false otherwise
